titleStmt.title: Theodore D. Rand to Thomas B. Monroe, Jr.
CWG2433

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Civil Appointments, 1859-1862

body.p:
THEODORE D. RAND,
ATTORNEY AT LAW,
No. 32 SOUTH THIRD STREET.
COMMISSIONER OF DEEDS
FOR
ALABAMA,
ARKANSAS,
CONNECTICUT,
FLORIDA,
GEORGIA,
INDIANA,
IOWA,
KENTUCKY,
MASSACHUSETTS,
MAINE,
MARYLAND,
MICHIGAN,
MISSISSIPPI,
MISSOURI,
MINNESOTA,
NEW HAMPSHIRE,
NEW JERSEY,
NORTH CAROLINA,
OHIO,
RHODE ISLAND,
SOUTH CAROLINA,
TENNESSEE,
TEXAS,
VERMONT,
VIRGINIA,
WISCONSIN.

JOHN C. BULLITT.
FRED. FAIRTHORNE
BULLITT & FAIRTHORNE,
LAW AND COLLECTION OFFICE,
No. 32 SOUTH THIRD STREET.
I would most respectfully solicit a reappointment as Commissioner of your State. I was appointed March 7 1857 for the term of four years.
I enclose Five Dollars the State tax

Yours very Respy
Theo. D. Rand

To
The Secretary of State
Frankfort Ky.

Pennsylvania
Comr of Deeds
Theo. D. Rand
Philad
Comd Mar. 1. 1861
